intro: Riedelia aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange-flowered riedelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes cacti and related succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of bright orange flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are typically reduced to spines, a feature common in arid environments. Riedelia aurantiaca is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flowers and unique appearance.
